      • doLog

        public static void doLog(Level level,
                         String message)
        Hack to get around the shitty java logging api, where -Djava.util.logging.config=logging.properties doesn't seem to work, or i'm not specifying the right levels for the right Logger namespaces or some stuff. You specify the min logging level allowed in the realistic biomes config.yml, with the 'minLogLevel' key, specifed to a string. Either a Level name like INFO, or an integer This requires that the static Logger variable in RealisticBiomes has already been created (aka onEnable has been called)
        Parameters:
        level -
        message -

      • growAndPersistBlock

        public Plant growAndPersistBlock(org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                                 boolean naturalGrowEvent,
                                 GrowthConfig growthConfig,
                                 org.bukkit.block.Block fruitBlockToIgnore,
                                 DropGrouper dropGrouper)
        grow the specified block, return the new growth magnitude
        Parameters:
        block - The block to grow
        naturalGrowEvent - False if from player interaction (stick/block hit info)
        growthConfig - Growth config, will be looked up if null
        fruitBlockToIgnore - When checking for fruits, ignore this block. BlockBreak event needs this, since the block being broken is still in world until event has completed.
        Returns:
        Plant or null, to report growth back to player on interaction

      • growPlant

        public void growPlant(Plant plant,
                      org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                      GrowthConfig growthConfig,
                      org.bukkit.block.Block fruitBlockToIgnore,
                      DropGrouper dropGrouper)
        Grow the plant If not `fruitBlockToIgnore` is not null, this comes from BlockBreak. The event needs this, since the block being broken is still in world until event has completed.
        Parameters:
        plant -
        block -
        growthConfig -
        fruitBlockToIgnore - When checking for fruits, ignore this block
        dropGrouper -
